file_insights.description: Comprehensive design guide for Tahoe 26.x liquid glass design system - a glassmorphism system for native macOS and iOS applications
key_content: UIVisualEffectView and SwiftUI Materials for iOS
Semantic color palette with light/dark mode support
Typography scale based on SF Pro
Accessibility guidelines for VoiceOver, Dynamic Type, Reduced Motion
Component library structure for both platforms

patterns_discovered: Native visual effect APIs are core to implementation - NSVisualEffectView on macOS, UIVisualEffectView/SwiftUI Materials on iOS
Semantic colors automatically adapt to light/dark mode via system colors
Accessibility is built-in requirement with explicit environment variable usage
Graceful degradation pattern for older OS versions using availability checks
gotchas_discovered: Different visual effect APIs across platforms - no unified API
Material names differ between platforms (e.g., .hudWindow vs .systemThickMaterial)
Reduced motion preference requires explicit handling in code
Blur effects require hardware acceleration - may not work on all devices
High contrast mode may reduce visual effect visibility
Some blur styles have different availability across iOS versions
Static fallback colors needed for devices that cannot render blur effects
discoveries.approach_outcome: Successfully created a comprehensive 330-line design guide documenting the complete Tahoe 26.x glassmorphism design system with platform-specific implementation details, code examples, component library structure, color/typography/spacing systems, accessibility requirements, and backward compatibility strategies. The guide follows Apple's Human Interface Guidelines and includes implementation checklist.
recommendations: Implement the documented components (GlassPanel, GlassCard, GlassButton, GlassSheet for macOS; BlurView, GlassContainer, GlassButton, GlassCard for iOS) following the guide specifications
Add automated design token validation tests to ensure spacing, colors, and typography match the design guide
Set up CI/CD pipeline to automatically generate and publish design documentation
Consider creating a shared Swift Package for common design system utilities
Add interactive playground/examples app demonstrating all components
Implement visual regression tests for glass effects across OS versions
Create dark mode and accessibility audit tooling
Document component props/API in TypeScript if cross-platform React Native support is planned
